job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: <p>As part of a high performing global team, the right candidate will play a hands-on role in the design and development for implementing Machine learning best practices in network traffic data collection, processing, analysis, and monitoring.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Responsibilities&nbsp;:-</p><ul><li>Design, develop and maintain key frameworks, services and applications for network traffic data collection, processing, analysis, correlation, and monitoring in Cloud Products.&nbsp;</li><li>Experience with applying statistical distribution analysis to data.</li><li>Hands on experience in designing batch-based, real-time streaming and event-based data solutions (Spark, Storm, Flink etc.&nbsp;Kafka expertise highly desired)</li><li>Proficient with microservices-based, API/Endpoint architectures</li><li>Experience in network traffic data collection, processing, analysis, and monitoring, and solid understanding of protocols TCP/IP, IPv4/IPv6, NetFlow, sFlow, IPFix. Netconf/Yang</li><li>Understanding of concepts of Radius, PPPoE IP, DHCP IP, SNMP.</li><li>Highly proficient in Java, Go, Nodejs, Scala, or similar programming languages.</li><li>Experience in building and productizing cloud-based/scale data ingestion (preferably in AWS)</li><li>Experience in cloud data solutions like Elastic, Greenplum, Redshift or like technologies a plus.&nbsp;</li><li>5 -10 years of highly technical, hands-on software engineering experience. Independent and Self driven and works in a Team.</li><li>Customer facing engineering role in debugging and resolving field issues.</li><li>Participate and drive technical discussions within engineering group in all phases of the SDLC: review requirements, produce design documents, participate in Peer reviews, produce test plans, support QA team, provide internal training and support TAC team.&nbsp;</li><li>Organized and goal-focused, ability to deliver in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Strong, creative problem-solving skills and ability to abstract and share details to create meaningful articulation.</li><li>Implementation background in various data processing, consumption patterns, and pipelines.</li></ul><p></p>
